definitions.text: capital of the state of New Hampshire; located in south central New Hampshire on the Merrimack river
a harmonious state of things in general and of their properties (as of colors and sounds); congruity of parts with one another and with the whole
the determination of grammatical inflection on the basis of word relations
town in eastern Massachusetts near Boston where the first battle of the American Revolution was fought
the first battle of the American Revolution (April 19, 1775)

examples: Concord the conditions for the marriage of the Prince of Wales with a commoner

definitions.text: arrange the words of a text so as to create a concordance
examples: The team concorded several thousand nouns, verbs, and adjectives

definitions.text: be in accord; be in agreement
examples: We agreed on the terms of the settlement
I hold with those who say life is sacred
Both philosophers concord on this point
